posts.body: Since it was posted with a zeroid they should be able to see it fine.

>>16f56887-5153-488b-83e7-74efbf1a17d0
There was a bug in Millchan that prevented big files from being uploaded.
See: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:bb0537f5-e5bb-41b6-9f7f-f4d855fb0d18#post-707b36f2-48f1-4ab8-b8f5-d67ac29f3e0e

If you're using an updated version of the engine then it should work fine.

>>e46a746d-6288-4865-b4b5-0e3bb75ab6a2
>>10e21b00-c131-4dad-9797-a7b2a7eef2a8
>201908081621
That code is outdated. There was a significant memory leak that was fixed in the last days.

>>55938bff-9f13-4562-83e4-80c098de6b5e
>Pinning works is like this. Any image that loads on your browser while you're on a board you've pinned will be downloaded and start seeding.
Pinning doesn't automatically download files.
The only thing it does is preventing images you've [Seed]ed from being automatically removed by ZeroNet when your client reaches the optional file limit.

>>09ac6230-9742-4e8a-b4a3-538ff3c98e99
There isn't but it would be simple to patch MC's source code to do that.
It should also have a max file size limit to prevent anyone with that option enabled from downloading GBs of random garbage immediately after seeing it.
Update.

>>51d43432-d683-4f8d-8610-6fe95a400264
>and other problems
Such as?

>>c1439ddf-f475-41d5-b913-9ef698d7d73a
>I'm talking 15 GB with a couple tabs open
That has already been fixed days ago.
ZeroFrame was keeping the results of every callback in memory which means nothing was ever being garbage collected.
The main thread being locked it's still something to be addressed but for now it should be mitigated by the ability of loading only the last posts of the thread.

>>793ed090-0829-4842-be23-fd8cd0dcfcaa
>But if we have our own hub, it should be relatively trivial to disable the merger mechanics that grant moderator powers. 
It seems you're confusing things there.
"Millchan" is not the same as "Millchan engine".

>>5ef0e1e8-71f6-407e-9da4-fefee34a0350
>At least two anons reporting not being able to post on instances using the patch.
Not really much information to work with there.
If you have any ''specific'' bugs with the engine itself then I'm sure the development team will be interested in hearing about it so that it can be properly investigated and fixed.

>>3e20f065-7ca2-448a-8245-a00a7d2de3ec
>this means it might be a bit slower than a production build
Yes you're adding an extra overhead of parsing MBs of JS that will not be there in the production build.
The optimal build for performance would be the production build without main/vendor compression which is only there to decrease the amount of data that has to be exchanged between peers.

>>ab9e2577-9644-47e0-8df7-1e6bf1314782
It's not just minification. The third party libs also add extra information to development builds that will be stripped in production builds.
Other optimizations like tree shaking are also only executed when building in production mode.

>>b1f857ba-feac-402f-a076-06e379279521
>08ch admin
>coding
This should be simple enough for the admin to enable it and it might be useful since apparently it is supported by most browsers nowadays.

>>e4e399c1-c888-4759-92f9-342c2f295cb4
There is already an option to hide for everyone by default but regular users can still see the IDs with a simple JS edit.
Also, I'm not sure why you think pretending we're all anonymous would be any better than being transparent about the fact that there is correlation between posts and the IDs people are using.

>>c7efbd2c-9a13-4386-b72d-73436fbefd25
>1. Mute button on the catalog
Already done.
>5. Research the possibility of setting up a custom CA, which would make it possible to generate certs for every post
Some research on that has already been done.
Not possible with the current ZeroNet restrictions but it should work if you implement the modifications upstream and then on Millchan.
Of course it would make DDoS attacks easier than before.
>7. Research CPU based proof-of-work for posting
ZeroNet already allows the creation of PoW based certificates.
>11. A version of the board's software that doesn't display names by default and doesn't show the option to enable them (2/10)
>(2/10)
That would be 3 lines of code but removing the option entirely doesn't sound like a great idea to be to me.
Not much point in pretending every post is anonymous when they aren't.
Also, it would be as trivial to add it back in as it will be to remove it.
>13. Make Millchan faster and less bloated 
I vote for you to try that one.

>>c4a775f6-ce1a-4a57-989d-36cfd6240295
>Thanks for repeating what i just said.
I meant an option for the admin, retard.
Also, JS edit != CSS edit.
Learn to read.

>Go to voat if thats what you want
What I WANT is irrelevant, moron.
That's the way things ARE.

>>a35efd5c-1a54-4f0c-8c79-4a7ba3a75553
>Mute button on the catalog
https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/cd1dc4da1c53818f5ac5df2d09484ec76c184f42

https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/d12852f8a5b8b7bddc0bb120f25b12c025002b2a
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/8@1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1258#issuecomment-436836317

>>fffb36d8-efb9-495a-94dc-a28bb8f98f51
See the GitCenter issue above.
ZeroNet doesn't currently allow changing the `auth_address` for the same CA like that.
Meaning your CA could well create and sign a new cert for every post but the `auth_address` will not update to reflect the fact that the user has changed to a new certificate meaning he won't be able to publish anymore.

If this issue if resolved then it would became trivial to create a new cert for every post similarly to what's being done in Millchan's anon-posts branch.

>>2594cc19-d7e6-46c6-a826-e479289a6449
"Seed all" = seed all files in the current post.
"Help seed files" = automatically seed all files posted by the user from now on.

>>e5c1c4ab-efc0-41aa-9e83-f25975f5d385
>Follow thread 
It should show the thread replies in the [ZeroHello](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) feed.

>>38d325c7-e00a-4d00-bc05-ff1489caefe5
>Why would a custom CA need to change auth_address rather than just generate new ones?
What exactly would be the point of generating new ones if the user is '''always''' stuck with the first one that has been added, essentially?
If you still don't understand the problem then go ahead and try implementing your idea.

>>9922e6e4-0339-48c8-829b-2bf2e6a59953
>So the Zite can force a new self signed cert to be created?
You can for the current auth_address associated with the zite.
Since you can't change the auth_address there is currently no way for a CA to issue multiple certificates for the same user without him having to fiddle with his master seed and restart ZeroNet.

>>3cd216d9-0fee-4332-b5af-8d9fe8c99d41
Not sure but the core idea is simple enough if that's the thing you're interested in it.
A webserver with two endpoints should be enough.
One to issue challenges and another to verify and return signatures.

>>dcd82545-60ee-4548-a0ee-89642786fd6d
>Though on Millchan, it works..
08chan's code is outdated.
[Fix thread follow/unfollow](https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/fe8a8a4ed2cd1f81adde4b768715a98a4d2b17ce)
>authored 1 week ago

>>babe4260-b39f-4d80-99b8-d8bd51120f7b
>theoretical limit seems to be 5 MB in content.json
`max_size` only defines the limit of required files.
To define the limit of optinal files (images and whatnot) the admin would need to define the key `max_size_optional`.
If that value is not defined then there is no limit to the amount of optional files that users are able to publish.

>how does a zite get admin permissions
Try fiddling with `data/sites.json`.
You may need to add "ADMIN" to the `permissions` array or something like that.

>>005a36fc-1eea-40cc-9ce1-963e8456f4b2
No. The files in `files` object inside the content.json of each user counts as required.

>>e418e707-d5d4-4f84-9493-7fbb40049bc1
>So do you think someone could spam self signed user folders with 0 length data.json files?
I don't know. Probably.

>ZeroID seems to have an empty permissions array btw.
I was assuming your were talking about the [admin commands](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#admin-commands)
As far as I know ZeroID doesn't work as a regular decentralized zite.
It is just a regular server running php execs to ZeroNet to issue certificates.
It doesn't seem like you need any additional permissions in that case.

>>e418e707-d5d4-4f84-9493-7fbb40049bc1

That seems to be the case.

>>86eeb73f-8c43-4ad8-a2eb-29f019966fbb
>should never(!) be given to any zites
Maybe not but there are some API commands that are limited to ADMIN which don't make much sense to me like `serverShowdirectory` to open an user directory.
I don't see why regular zites aren't allowed to execute this. It'd significantly simplify verifying content downloaded by a given user.

>>8d7ee359-db75-4155-831a-f57784a251e6
>Have you tested if that cmd really doesn't do anything?
Yeah. From my experience the only thing it does is displaying a prompt to the user saying "You don't have permission to run".

Probably updating the site's object in users.json.

>>94edda54-f61b-4410-96ed-e46b42d61c73
I misread your post.
The issue I see with PoW certs is scalability.
I don't see how it can be implemented while being fair to every (or at least most) possible device.

If it's too hard most people won't have the patience to generate it.
If it's too easy than any non-retard spammer will be able to fuck your shit up.

>>0f7b98b2-c57c-4787-9961-8ef49b076290
Identifying yourself in every new identify you create seems to somewhat undermine the purpose of that.
